items.title: Array.prototype.groupBy
items.content:
#â€‹569 â€” December 17, 2021

UnsubscribeÂ Â |Â Â Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

Deep-Copying in JavaScript Using structuredClone â€” Ever had to resort to workarounds and libraries to create a deep copy of a value? structuredClone() to the rescue as a built-in function for deep-copying. Surma shows it off in this post, but note that support is currently patchy but due to take offÂ soon.

Surma

â–¶Â Â A Recap of React Conf 2021 â€” React Conf took place online for the first time this year and this is a fantastic summary of what took place along with videos of the talks and why you might watch some of them. The main keynote covered the state of concurrency, Suspense, server components, React Native, andÂ more.

Jesslyn Tannady and Rick Hanlon

Kickstart Your Software Engineering Career â€” Ready to start learning software engineering? Learn 1:1 with an expert mentor to master the skills, build your portfolio, and gain experience needed to land a software engineering role. Apply to Springboard's Software Engineering Bootcamp to start yourÂ journey.

Springboard sponsor

Create React App 5.0: The Popular 'One Command' React App Builder â€” Few projects in the React world have been as successful as Create React App which has brought single command app generation to the masses. v5.0 includes fast refresh improvements, support for Tailwind, and a lot of dependency updates including webpack 5, Jest 27 and ESLint 8. Youâ€™ll need to be running Node 14+Â too.

Meta

IN BRIEF:

  • Hemanth HM has some updates from the 87th meeting of TC39 including the status of several proposals.

  • The company behind Deno has joined ECMA, and Luca Casonato now sits on the TC39 working group to help guide the development of JavaScript.

  • A â–¶ï¸ 45 minute talk with Rich Harris on the future of Svelte.

  • The State of CSS 2021 survey has concluded and the results are now available to peruse.

RELEASES:

Deno 1.17 â€“ Server-side JS/TS runtime.
GSAP 3.9 â€“ JavaScript animation system.
Ember CLI 4.0 â€“ CLI for building Ember apps.
Got 12.0 â€“ HTTP client for Node.js.
NVM for Windows 1.1.9 â€“ Node.js version manager.
bignumber.js 9.0.2 â€“ Arbitrary-precision decimal arithmetic.
React PDF 5.6 â€“ Render PDFs in React apps.

ğŸ’» Jobs

JavaScript Developer at X-Team (Remote) â€” Join the most energizing community for developers and work on long-term projects for Riot Games, FOX, Sony, Coinbase, andÂ more.
X-Team

Frontend Developer ğŸš€(Remote, Work from Anywhere ğŸ–) â€” We're reimagining eCommerce with a super fast headless commerce service for product storytellers. React, Node, GraphQL? Let'sÂ talk.
Crystallize

Find JavaScript Jobs with Hired â€” Create a profile on Hired to connect with hiring managers at growing startups and Fortune 500 companies. It's free forÂ job-seekers.
Hired

ğŸ“–Â Tutorials, Opinions & Stories

The Performance Implications of JavaScript Errors â€” Thereâ€™s more to think about with performance and errors than first meets the eye. For example, your page could get faster when an error causes less code to beÂ run.

Amit Singh

Array.prototype.groupBy to the Rescue? â€” There are plenty of ways to group elements in arrays into objects, as shown here, but TC39 is coming to the rescue (we hope) with a currently advancing proposal for array grouping methods like groupBy. Bring itÂ on.

Nicolas Charpentier

Who Guards the Guards â€“ 3 Common Pitfalls of JavaScriptÂ Testing â€” Learn how to eliminate certain types of issues from your test code in this TestJS Summit talk by SonarSource JSÂ expert.

SonarSource sponsor

How to Access ES Module Metadata using import.meta â€” How to access the meta information (module URL, etc.) of an ES module from JavaScriptÂ code.

Dmitri Pavlutin

Wide Gamut 2D Graphics using HTML Canvas â€” A look at the support for graphics in wider gamut color spaces than sRGB (such as Display P3) inside the canvas element in the newestÂ Safari.

Cameron McCormack (WebKit)

An Introduction to Framer Motion 3D for 3D Animation in React â€” Framer Motion is a popular Web animation toolkit and thereâ€™s a 3D animation option that uses React Three Fiber under the hood. Some nice sandbox demos here to playÂ with.

Framer

â–¶Â Â Global State Management in an Vue.js Electron App with Pinia
Cody Bontecou

The Only Two Custom React Hooks We Ever Really Use
Luke Hager

ğŸ› Â Code & Tools

Riot.js 6.1: A Simple and Elegant Component-Based UI Library â€” An interesting alternative UI library that might click with you. â€œIt is designed to offer you everything you wished the native web components API provided.â€ GitHubÂ repo.

Riot.js

Caterwaul: An (Experimental) JavaScript-to-JavaScript Compiler â€” Described as a â€˜monstrosityâ€™ for the â€˜adventurousâ€™, this transpiler is exploring ideas around manipulating JavaScript code at the low level to change the semantics of functions and transform code in â€˜arcaneâ€™Â ways.

Spencer Tipping

Shortcut is Project Management Without the Management â€” Looking for an intuitive white-board style project management tool? Collaboration has never been easier withÂ Shortcut.

Shortcut (formerly Clubhouse.io) sponsor

OpenSeadragon 3.0: A Web Viewer for Ultra High Resolution Images â€” Quite an old project now, but works well and is perfect for a specific use case, especially if you need to support certain high res image tileÂ formats.

OpenSeadragon contributors

CSS-Select 4.2: A CSS Selector Compiler and Engine â€” Turns CSS selectors into functions that tests if elements matchÂ them.

Felix BÃ¶hm

Want to Transfer a Domain with No Downtime? ğŸ‘€ Our HandyÂ Checklist ğŸ‘‰

DNSimple sponsor

roughViz.js: Hand-Drawn Styled Charts in the Browser â€” Supports bar, donut, line, pie, scatter and stacked bar charts and uses Rough.js under the hood for the drawingÂ operations.

Jared Wilber

Neutralino 4.0: Portable, Lightweight Desktop App Framework â€” Think Electron but rather than including a Chromium distribution with every app, it uses the local platformâ€™s built-in â€˜webview.â€™ GitHubÂ repo.

Codezri

deeplinks.js: Simple Deep Links to Any Selection of Text On Your Website
Wesley Aptekar-Cassels

Luminous: A Simple No-Dependency JavaScript Lightbox Control
imgix

items.title: Cutting down on JavaScript
items.content:
#â€‹568 â€” December 10, 2021

UnsubscribeÂ Â |Â Â Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

ğŸ“‰ Â How We Cut 99% of Our JavaScript with Qwik and Partytown â€” Itâ€™s neat to see the original creator of Angular talking about cutting down on the amount of JavaScript! :-) The Qwik framework and Partytown were used here to both serve up less JS, and then kick most of the execution away from the main JSÂ thread â€” a neat approach.

MiÅ¡ko Hevery

â–¶Â Â A Coding Interview with Dan Abramov â€” Dan Abramov, best known for his fantastic Overreacted blog and co-creating Redux, bravely subjects himself to a â€˜coding interviewâ€™ with Ben Awad. They cover a mixture of JavaScript and frontend topics, including.. centering aÂ div!

Ben Awad and Dan Abramov

Put the â€œFlowâ€ in Your Workflows with Shortcut â€” Imagine how much more you could get done if your project management tools didn't make you sigh. Shortcut is the ideal solution for task management, bug tracking, iteration planning, and reporting. Delight the scrum gods and give us a try forÂ free.

Shortcut (formerly Clubhouse.io) sponsor

GitHub Rolling Out Enforced 2FA and More Security for npm RegistryÂ Logins â€” Many public code package registries have suffered issues with user security in recent years, including npm, so GitHub are moving forward with plans for â€˜enhanced login verificationâ€™ including enforced 2FA for publishers of high impact packages in earlyÂ 2022.

Myles Borins

IN BRIEF:

  • ğŸŒŸ Starred a lot of repos on GitHub? If you want to organize them, GitHub now has a new 'lists' feature in beta, or you could run this code and just delete themÂ all.

  • The November edition of VS Code is out â€“Â a key feature is the default highlighting of 'uncommon' invisible characters, as were the culprits in the recent The Invisible JavaScript Backdoor article. JSX attribute completions too, if you want those.

  • Months in the making, React has very experimental support for custom elements behind a flag if you want to play.

RELEASES:

Mongoose 6.1 â€“ MongoDB ODM for Node.js.
V8Go 0.7 â€“ Execute JS from Go(lang).
eslint-plugin-vue 8.2 â€“ Official Vue plugin for ESLint.
Preact 10.6.4 â€“ Fast & light React alternative.
Prettier 2.5.1

ğŸ’» Jobs

Senior JavaScript Developer (Fullstack) â€” Weâ€™re looking for a senior full-stack developer to help us build a high performance, high accuracy online fraud preventionÂ service.
FingerprintJS

Senior Software Engineer (Frontend, Remote) â€” Weâ€™re hiring a software engineer to join our team working on PSPDFKit for Web. We are building a modern PDF SDK with technologies like React, TypeScript, andÂ WebAssembly.
PSPDFKit

Find JavaScript Jobs with Hired â€” Create a profile on Hired to connect with hiring managers at growing startups and Fortune 500 companies. It's free forÂ job-seekers.
Hired

ğŸ“–Â Tutorials, Opinions & Stories

Cubic BÃ©zier: From Math to Motion â€” Underpinning any sort of realistic animated motion is some tricky math, the cornerstone of which is the BÃ©zier curve. This article makes the connection between the theory and what eventually ends up on theÂ screen.

Maxime Heckel

Plugging Memory Leaks in Your App â€” â€œIn any reasonably sized app, you can bet memory is leaking somewhere,â€ says Stoyan, so having a how to on mitigating such leaks is useful. React is used as the basis for the examples here but the basic concepts apply elsewhereÂ too.

Stoyan Stefanov

ğŸ’¡ And as it happens, Microsoft Edge has added a new Detached Elements tool to help you investigate and resolve DOM-oriented memory leaks.

Data Visualization Made Easy with ReactJS, Nivo and InfluxDB â€” Learn how to query from InfluxDB with the client libraries to visualize withÂ Nivo.

InfluxData sponsor

â–¶Â Â Build a Color Contrast Checker with Eleventy Serverless â€” A lightning talk about using Eleventy Serverless to build a zero client-side JavaScriptÂ app.

Ben Myers

â–¶Â Â Why Ruby2JS is a Game Changer â€” Ruby2JS is a Ruby to JavaScript transpiler, and Jared argues its main value is in being able to write as if JavaScript had Rubyâ€™s rich syntax and standardÂ library.

Jared White podcast

Optimizing State Management in React Apps
Krasimir Tsonev

Reasons to Avoid JavaScript CDNs
Wesley Aptekar-Cassels

ğŸ› Â Code & Tools

Tailwind CSS v3.0 Released â€” Tailwind CSS is an increasingly popular CSS framework, and while weâ€™d usually just mention it in Frontend Focus, v3.0 has an interesting JavaScript related feature: Play CDN, which lets you use Tailwind CSS on any Web page using a single script tag (for development or demos, say).

Adam Wathan (Tailwind)

vue-agile 2.0: A Carousel Component for Vue â€” Responsive, touch-friendly, with Nuxt.js SSR support, and doesnâ€™t include any predefined styles, so its look is fully customizable. DemosÂ here.

Åukasz Florczak

Build Internal Tools in Minutes with Retool, Where Visual Programming Meets the Power of Real Code

Retool sponsor

graphql-request: A Minimal GraphQL Client for Node and Browsers â€” The target use here is small scripts and simple apps, not larger things where something like Apollo might provide the structure youÂ need.

Prisma Labs

ts-belt: A Practical Utility Library for FP in TypeScript â€” The getting started docs tell the story best, but the author essentially loves ReScript, but acknowledges TypeScriptâ€™s popularity and aims to bring some of ReScriptâ€™s functional practices to TS via this library. GitHubÂ repo.

Marcin Dziewulski et al.

COBE: A 5KB WebGL Globe Rendering Library â€” You can try out an impressive demo here and the API is simple and easy toÂ use.

Shu Ding

Build a Mobile-Responsive Telehealth Pager App Using Streamâ€™s ChatÂ API

Stream sponsor

OpenLayers 6.9: High Performance Frontend Mapping Library â€” A system for putting dynamic maps onto your pages that can render map tiles pulled from various sources, vector data layers, markers, etc.

OpenLayers

Interface Forge: Graceful Mock-Data and Fixture Generation with TypeScript
Na'aman Hirschfeld

Zod: TypeScript-First Schema Validation with Static Type Inference
Colin McDonnell

items.title: Happy 26th birthday to JavaScript
items.content:
#â€‹567 â€” December 3, 2021

UnsubscribeÂ Â |Â Â Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

asciinema-player, Now 4x Smaller and 50x Faster with JS and Rust â€” asciinema is a Python-based terminal screen recorder (think Camtasia but for text!) but to play its recordings on the Web asciinema-player is used. Originally written in ClojureScript, a mixed JS + Rust build (plus a little SolidJS) has hugely improved itsÂ performance. Will we continue to see more collaborations between Rust and JavaScript in future?Â Definitely.

Marcin Kulik

Mitosis: Write Components Once, Run Everywhere â€” In simple scientific terms, mitosis is a process where a cell divides into two child cells, but in this case itâ€™s a single component code base that can compile into different forms usable with Vue, React, Solid, Angular, Svelte, and more. The playground lets you see how it worksÂ out.

Builder.io

Introduction to Gatsby Course with Jason Lengstorf â€” Learn to build blazing-fast apps and websites with React using Gatsby, covering all angles from using GraphQL to store and retrieve data, image optimization, displaying third party data in components, right through toÂ deployment.

Frontend Masters sponsor

Floating UI: Positioning for Tooltips, Popovers, Dropdowns, etc. â€” If this reminds you of Tippy.js or Popper at all, itâ€™s similar and shares a creator and contributor respectively who says itâ€™s â€œdesigned to be a next-generation evolution". It certainly looks and feels nice, is lightweight, and can be customized by way ofÂ middleware.

atomiks

'Thank You, Angular' (and Thank You, Igor!) â€” Igor has been a leader and fundamental part on the Angular team for, amazingly, over 12 years now, but heâ€™s moving on. In this post he reflects on the projectâ€™s history, his involvement with it, how Angular is now used in over 2500 apps(!) at Google, and whoâ€™s helping to plug the gap heÂ leaves.

Igor Minar

IN BRIEF:

  • ğŸ‚ Tomorrow, it's 26 years since JavaScript debuted meaning JS shares a birthday with Jay Z and Marisa Tomei. One sweet day.

  • AWS has unveiled AWS Amplify Studio, essentially a 'Figma to fullstack React app' visual dev environment leaning upon its usual bundle of Amplify services.

  • Like a good daily coding puzzle? Advent of Code has started its 2021 run.

  • Egghead and Jon Meyers have a new course on building a SaaS product with Next.js, Supabase and Stripe available to enjoy for no charge.

RELEASES:

WEBMIDI.js 3.0 â€“ Easier MIDI from the Web.
Node 17.2.0 â€“ Node updates to V8 9.6.
npm 8.2.0
Polly 6.0 â€“ Netflix's HTTP recording and replay library.
DOCX 7.2 â€“ Generate .docx files from JavaScript.
React PDF Reader 1.0 â€“ Component wrapping PDF.js.

ğŸ’» Jobs

Grow a Design System at Addepar â€” Work with a talented team of designers and engineers on the foundation for Addeparâ€™s expanding UX. Weâ€™re building tools that keep our customer experience one of the best inÂ Fintech.
Addepar

JavaScript Developer at X-Team (Remote) â€” Join the most energizing community for developers and work on long-term projects for Riot Games, FOX, Sony, Coinbase, andÂ more.
X-Team

Find JavaScript Jobs with Hired â€” Create a profile on Hired to connect with hiring managers at growing startups and Fortune 500 companies. It's free forÂ job-seekers.
Hired

ğŸ“–Â Tutorials, Opinions & Stories

JSON Modules in JavaScript â€” Typically when you use import itâ€™s for importing JavaScript code, but what if you had some configuration settings in a JSON file and wanted to import it directly? Enter the JSON modules proposal which is at stage 3 with experimental support available in Node or within the Chrome 91Â browser.

Dmitri Pavlutin

Publishing a Web Component to npm â€” Simonâ€™s always good at explaining stuff and, as an aside, his Datasette project is well worth checking out if you work with datasets atÂ all.

Simon Willison

Find and Fix Things Faster Across Your Code with Sourcegraph â€” Nobody likes feeling caught between the pressure to improve your codebase and the pressure to protect it. Release anxietyâ€“ weâ€™ve beenÂ there.

Sourcegraph sponsor

Determining the Best Starting Word in a Word Game â€” WORDLE is an online word game thatâ€™s a bit like â€˜Mastermindâ€™ but with 5 letter words. And, of course, if youâ€™re a developer, why not use code to improve yourÂ guesses?

Bertrand Fan

How to Trim Strings in JavaScript â€” Specifically, removing whitespace and line terminatorsÂ safely.

Dmitri Pavlutin

How to Set Up Server Side Rendering (SSR) with React, Express.js, and esbuild
Adam Berg

ğŸ› Â Code & Tools

Strapi v4: An Open Source Node.js Headless CMS â€” Strapi has been around a while and has done a good job building a community around itself. A big new version is out with a new UI, Plugin API, Query Engine and more, plus a focus on refactoring the core to make it easier to extend and twist to your own ends. Hereâ€™s the getting startedÂ tutorial.

Alexandre Bodin

Plotly.js 2.7: A Data Viz Built on D3 and Stack.gl â€” Itâ€™s been a couple of years since we last featured Plotly, but it continues to get very frequent updates. It ships with over 40 chart types including 3D visualizations â€“ see examplesÂ here.

Plotly

Data Visualization: Build React Graphs the Easy Way â€” Letâ€™s explore an efficient way to create React graphs (Donut, Bar, Line, Sparkline) with the KendoReact ChartsÂ library.

Progress KendoReact sponsor

Ladda: Buttons with Built-In Loading Indicators â€” Sweet and simple. Ideal for form submissions in particular. GitHubÂ repo.

Hakim El Hattab

WMR: A Tiny Multitool for Building Modern Web Apps â€” Everything you need in a single tool for putting together JS-powered webapps with bundling, JSX, CSS modules support, and more. Ideal for prototyping. GitHubÂ repo.

Preact

noUiSlider: Lightweight Range Slider with Full Touch Support â€” No dependency. Fits into wherever you need it. Great homepage too. GitHubÂ repo.

Leon Gersen

Deliver Safer & Cleaner Code For Free - Directly in Visual Studio 2022

SonarLint sponsor

jsvu: JavaScript (Engine) Version Updater â€” A tool for installing new JavaScript engines without compiling them fromÂ source.

Google

ğŸ•¹ Â TEGA: TypeScript Embedded GameBoy Macro Assembler â€” Extremely niche, but essentially lets you create GameBoy ROMs from TS or JS. I have zero need to do this, but if you ever do, maybe this example will win youÂ over.

Francis Stokes

ğŸ Â promisio: JavaScript-Style Async Programming for Python â€” Is this now Python Weekly? No, but Python continues to be on the up and up for many use cases, but what if you want your JS style asyncÂ functions?

Miguel Grinberg

web-ext: Command Line Tool to Help Build, Run, and Test Web Extensions
Mozilla

Ember Infinity: Simple, Flexible Infinite Scroll for Ember CLI Apps

Converse 9.0: A Web-Based XMPP/Jabber Chat Client Written in JS

ğŸ§ŠÂ  And finally...

blockify-yourself â€” Earlier this week former Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey â€˜did a Zuckâ€™ and rebranded Square, Inc to Block, complete with new logo. Said logo was even incorporated into the headshots on the Board of Directors pageâ€¦after much mocking, now, you can of course get your own blocky headshot via this Glitch project (which usesÂ Three.js).

Julius Tarng
items.contentSnippet:
#â€‹567 â€” December 3, 2021


UnsubscribeÂ Â |Â Â Read on the Web



JavaScript Weekly




  





  
  
asciinema-player, Now 4x Smaller and 50x Faster with JS and Rust â€” asciinema is a Python-based terminal screen recorder (think Camtasia but for text!) but to play its recordings on the Web asciinema-player is used. Originally written in ClojureScript, a mixed JS + Rust build (plus a little SolidJS) has hugely improved itsÂ performance. Will we continue to see more collaborations between Rust and JavaScript in future?Â Definitely.
Marcin Kulik 


  
  
Mitosis: Write Components Once, Run Everywhere â€” In simple scientific terms, mitosis is a process where a cell divides into two child cells, but in this case itâ€™s a single component code base that can compile into different forms usable with Vue, React, Solid, Angular, Svelte, and more. The playground lets you see how it worksÂ out.
Builder.io 


  
  
Introduction to Gatsby Course with Jason Lengstorf â€” Learn to build blazing-fast apps and websites with React using Gatsby, covering all angles from using GraphQL to store and retrieve data, image optimization, displaying third party data in components, right through toÂ deployment.
Frontend Masters sponsor


  
  
Floating UI: Positioning for Tooltips, Popovers, Dropdowns, etc. â€” If this reminds you of Tippy.js or Popper at all, itâ€™s similar and shares a creator and contributor respectively who says itâ€™s â€œdesigned to be a next-generation evolution". It certainly looks and feels nice, is lightweight, and can be customized by way ofÂ middleware.
atomiks 


  
  
'Thank You, Angular' (and Thank You, Igor!) â€” Igor has been a leader and fundamental part on the Angular team for, amazingly, over 12 years now, but heâ€™s moving on. In this post he reflects on the projectâ€™s history, his involvement with it, how Angular is now used in over 2500 apps(!) at Google, and whoâ€™s helping to plug the gap heÂ leaves.
Igor Minar 


IN BRIEF:
ğŸ‚ Tomorrow, it's 26 years since JavaScript debuted meaning JS shares a birthday with Jay Z and Marisa Tomei. One sweet day.
AWS has unveiled AWS Amplify Studio, essentially a 'Figma to fullstack React app' visual dev environment leaning upon its usual bundle of Amplify services.
Like a good daily coding puzzle? Advent of Code has started its 2021 run.
Egghead and Jon Meyers have a new course on building a SaaS product with Next.js, Supabase and Stripe available to enjoy for no charge.
RELEASES:
WEBMIDI.js 3.0 â€“ Easier MIDI from the Web.
Node 17.2.0 â€“ Node updates to V8 9.6.
npm 8.2.0
Polly 6.0 â€“ Netflix's HTTP recording and replay library.
DOCX 7.2 â€“ Generate .docx files from JavaScript.
React PDF Reader 1.0 â€“ Component wrapping PDF.js.





ğŸ’» Jobs





  
Grow a Design System at Addepar â€” Work with a talented team of designers and engineers on the foundation for Addeparâ€™s expanding UX. Weâ€™re building tools that keep our customer experience one of the best inÂ Fintech.

items.title: Remixing a new way to build full-stack JavaScript apps
items.content:
#â€‹566 â€” November 26, 2021

UnsubscribeÂ Â |Â Â Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

Remix: A Newly Open Sourced React-Based Framework for WebÂ Apps â€” Remix has been around for over a year as â€˜sponsorwareâ€™ but after picking up a lot of ardent supporters (and $3m of seed funding) the project has now been opened up. Bringing modern Web tech, tooling, and server-side rendering concepts together, there are a few things to check out if you're keen to learn more:

  • The project's official â–¶ï¸ 50 second Apple-esque commercial/pitch.
  • â–¶ï¸ Kent C Dodd's multi-hour tutorial walkthrough. Almost a 'course' inÂ scope.
  • An introduction to building a Remix app with Flavio Copes.
  • A â–¶ï¸ seven minute review with Ahmad Awais.
  • Want to play? You can get building a Remix app right away thanks to StackBlitz's WebContainers at remix.new.

Remix Team

New Course: Introduction to Next.js, The Full-Stack React Framework â€” Next.js is a complete framework built on top of React.js. You'll learn server-side rendering, static site generation, data fetching, code API endpoints, creating pages with the file system, add CSS modules, andÂ more.

Frontend Masters sponsor

Vercel, Creator of Next.js, Raises $150M â€” Thereâ€™s a lot of money in developer tooling lately, it seems, including for the stewards of the Next.js project which gains a fresh competitor, of sorts, this week in the shape of Remix (above).

Vercel

Prettier 2.5 Released: Now with TypeScript 4.5 and MDX v2 Support â€” If youâ€™re a TypeScript user, this bump to the popular code formatting tool will be of particular interest toÂ you.

Sosuke Suzuki

IN BRIEF:

  • Why does npm run an obfuscated file that looks like malware, but isn't? It's a birthday related easter egg.

  • Not JS specific but AWS has just made a big change to its 'free tier' that might save many of us low-end users several bucks each month.

RELEASES:

Chalk 5.0 â€“ Terminal string styling for Node.js.
ShareDB 2.2 â€“ Realtime database based on operational transformation.
Signature Pad 4.0 â€“ Canvas control for drawing signatures.
node-qrcode 1.5 â€“ Generate QR codes in Node apps.
ESLint 8.3.0 â€“ Flexible code auditing tool.
Espree 9.1 â€“ Esprima-compatible JS parser.
React Redux v8 Beta

ğŸ’» Jobs

Senior JavaScript Developer (Fullstack) â€” Weâ€™re looking for a senior full-stack developer to help us build a high performance, high accuracy online fraud preventionÂ service.
FingerprintJS

Senior Mobile Developer (React Native/Node) â€“ Remote â€” Join Sippdâ€¤com, the Forbes Next1000 startup changing how users find and buy alcohol with AI & computer vision. Weâ€™re looking for a generalist that loves growth hacking and taking bigÂ bets.
Sippd

Find JavaScript Jobs with Hired â€” Create a profile on Hired to connect with hiring managers at growing startups and Fortune 500 companies. It's free forÂ job-seekers.
Hired

ğŸ“–Â Tutorials, Opinions & Stories

The Unexpected Return of JS for Automation on macOS â€” A long time Mac expert reflects on what JavaScript offers folks who want to automate macOS versus AppleScript or Python before digging some of what you canÂ do.

Armin Briegel

Introducing Svelte, and Comparing Svelte with React and Vue â€” If Svelte isnâ€™t new to you, keep scrolling. But if youâ€™re unsure what itâ€™s about, this is a reasonable explanation of why you might use it and the basicÂ experience.

Josh Collinsworth

How JavaScript Engines Achieve Great Performance â€” If youâ€™ve ever wondered what it is browsers actually do to get JavaScript to execute quickly, this post digs into it aÂ little.

Robin Heggelund Hansen

Notification Systems 2.0: Part 2 - Scale & Reliability

Courier sponsor

Using WebAssembly (Created in Rust) for Fast React Components â€” Just how easy is it to integrate Rust into a standard React workflow? Josh takes a look. This may seem a real meeting of buzzwords, but ideas like this have a way of turning into theÂ future..

Josh Finnie

Useful React Hooks That You Can Use In Your Projects
Ifeanyi Dike (Smashing Magazine)

Volta vs. nvm for JavaScript Tooling
Jon Surrell

Why IndexedDB Is Slow and What to Use Instead
RxDB Documentation

ğŸ› Â Code & Tools

Polly 5.2: Record, Replay, and Stub HTTP Interactions â€” Works in both Node and the browser and gives you a lot of control over recording, replaying and intercepting HTTP requests made from your testÂ suites.

Netflix, Inc.

Fiddle: The Easiest Way to Get Started with Electron â€” If youâ€™ve wanted to play with Electron for building a JavaScript-powered desktop app but didnâ€™t have the time, Fiddle makes it into more of a quick-start â€˜playgroundâ€™ experience.

Electron

Breakpoints and console.log Is the Past, Time Travel Is the Future â€” Test your code without leaving your editor, results display right next to your code and update immediately as youÂ type.

Quokka.js sponsor

reading-time: Reading Time Estimation for the Web â€” Feed it some text and itâ€™ll give you some basic estimates (e.g. â€˜7 minÂ readâ€™).

Nicolas Gryman

file-type: Detect the File Type of a Buffer, Uint8Array, or ArrayBuffer â€” For example, give it the raw data from a PNG file, and itâ€™ll tell you itâ€™s a PNGÂ file.

Sindre Sorhus

PickBetterPack: Discover Similar Packages from package.json Dependencies â€” Paste a package.json and this tool will show you a tree-like view with similar options for each dependency listed. A mixed bag, but an interestingÂ idea.

PickBetterPack

Tried. Tested. Trusted. Studio 3T - Power Tools for MongoDB â€” Intuitive IntelliShell. Generate JavaScript from queries. Reshape data with Reschema. Try Studio 3T free for 30Â days.

Studio 3T sponsor

use-prosemirror: Use the ProseMirror Editor in React Easily â€” ProseMirror is a popular toolkit for building rich textÂ editors.

Dmitry Minkovsky

Color 4: A Color Conversion and Manipulation Library â€” Immutable color conversion and manipulation with support for CSS colorÂ strings.

Qix

React Image Crop: A Responsive Image Cropping Tool
Dominic Tobias

ğŸµÂ Last but not least...

Elementary Grid: A JS + Elementary Powered Music Creator â€” Attempt to be the next deadmau5 with this JavaScript powered grid music creator.. or at least have a fun 30 seconds. Elementary is a toolkit we covered earlier this year that presents a new way to build audio software inÂ JavaScript.

Johan Althoff

title: JavaScript Weekly
description: A newsletter of JavaScript articles, news and cool projects
